content.description: Climb through blocky features to an arete, then right to anchors.
content.location: The first route after the scramble down to the creek. The start is at the last flat section before the trail steepens.

content.description: Climb past fins of rock to a transition right. Techy climbing to a slab crux, then continue up fun flakes to anchor.
content.location: Route starts on the first ledge after the steep approach, just below “Earth to Derek”.

content.description:
This multi-pitch moderate is a fun outing starting with a short granite wall, then onto slightly scruffy, very different rock. It has cleaned up considerably since the first ascent, and will only get better with more ascents. All cruxes are well protected, but there may be slight run-outs on easy terrain.

Approach: From the middle platform of Hansel's Hang-out, walk up-stream to the base of a short wall in the creek-bed - this is the approach pitch 5.5, 5 bolts. From the top, scramble left to the small ledge left of a chimney.

Pitch 1 : Start at the toe of the big red buttress.  The easiest way to access the start is by climbing the Approach Pitch from the stream bed.   First pitch is terrain for 20 feet to the first bolt, then continue up the face/arete to a large ledge with anchors. (5.8). 100'/7 bolts.

Pitch 2 : Climb up a ramp on the left, surmount a bulge, then continue up the featured face to a hueco with a crux bulge just below the anchors (5.8). 90'/9 bolts.

Pitch 3: Traverse left then up on the huecos and then continue on wandering fun slab with some interesting moves. (5.8) 115’/10 bolts.  Bring some long runners to mitigate rope drag on the traverse.

Pitch 4: Continue up the short featured granite to visit the “Pine Minister” of Malaysia. (5.6) 50’/6 draws.  Recommend the leader climb and lower back to the previous anchor to eliminate one rappel. Rap the route.
content.location: From the middle flat spot at Hansel's walk slightly up stream below a short wall. Scramble up and right around a bushy tree to gain the base of the steeper part of the wall. Start just below the obvious bolt in a small dihedral.

content.description:
Easy climbing leads to a steepening face, continue up easier but fun quartz to a moderate face. Surmount the final bulge to anchors.

NOTE: This route can be a bit tricky to back-clean on the lower - additionally, set a few directionals for top-roping..
content.location: Just to the right of “Coal Miner’s Son”, start at a small terrace below a large boulder.

content.description: Climb a brushy ramp (5.3 PG-13) to the 4th bolt of “Ewegoogily". A long draw can be used for the first clip. Continue past another 3 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Start on the left side of the ”Piano Tie Genius” ledge.

content.description: A featured slab leads to the lay-away crux bulge, then easy-but-fun quartz climbing to a steep pillar. Continue past a final bulge to anchors.

climbs.name: Ground School
climbs.fa: Milo Cagle and Herm Harrison, July 2021

content.description: Climb past several small roofs up the left side of an overhanging tiered pillar.  Move right into a nice hand and finger crack that ends at the summit of the formation.   Shady till past noon in July.  Fun and juggy with several cruxes.
content.location: Right most farthest uphill route on the crag.  About 70 feet uphill and right from "Earth to Derek".

content.description: Move right up the ramp past 2 bolts and the stem start. Make a long reach to a hole (harder if you’re short), then continue through the crux to a mantle. Climb up and right through a bulge, then face climb left to a ledge.
content.location: Just right of “Derelicte”, the line of bolts that starts higher on the ramp.

content.description:
Delicate climbing through varied, tricky features to a stance on a ledge. Continue up a fun dihedral.

Word on the street is this route is harder if you are short, so I gave it a split grade.
content.location: Just right of “Piano Tie Genius”, start on the large ledge half-way up the slope.

content.description: Climb an off-set crack and face holds on a steep wall with cool moves to a reachy crux. Continue up to a traverse left and a final slab section.
content.location:
Above the big boulder on the approach trail. Traverse in from the right or mantle the sloping ledge to start.

NOTE: There is a naturally refrigerated nook at the start of the climb to keep your food/drinks cold.

content.description: Climb a river-worn initial face through a bulge to a short scramble, continue up a fun dihedral/arete to a finishing face. Varied and long.
content.location: Start right of the descent approach near a large flat boulder. Right of “School for Ants” and a gully.

content.description: Climb the fun, featured short face on nice granite.  Crux is the first move off the ledge.  This is the easiest way to access the start and retreat off Malaysia.
content.location: From the middle flat spot at Hansel's walk slightly up stream below a short wall. Scramble up and right around a bushy tree to gain the base of the steeper part of the short granite wall. Start just below the obvious bolt in a small dihedral.
